Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the judicial review application is moot due to removal and dismissal of H&C application
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant was removed from Canada; H&C application dismissed
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of refusal to defer removal
Crimes.Court_Ruling: No live controversy exists; case is moot
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Removed applicant with dismissed H&C claim
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Immigration officer did not defer removal
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Request for deferral of removal pending H&C decision
Crimes.Legal_Standard: A case is moot if there is no live controversy affecting the rights of the parties
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Existence of collateral consequences or justification for use of judicial resources
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, sections related to removal orders and humanitarian considerations
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing of judicial review after removal
Crimes.Review_Standard: Standard for determining mootness in immigration cases
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Record of removal, dismissal of H&C application
Crimes.Application_Basis: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds pending at time of removal
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Official documentation of removal and application outcome
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Stay of removal pending H&C decision
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: No evidence of ongoing impact on rights
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No demonstrable future harm affecting immigration rights
Crimes.Cause_Description: Judicial review sought after removal; H&C application denied
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: None found; procedural issue of timing
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA s. 25(1) – Humanitarian and compassionate considerations
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Factual basis accepted; no contested facts
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No live controversy remains; no collateral consequences

Crimes.Violation_Type: Failure to comply with removal order timing
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reviewability of a moot challenge to non-deferral of removal
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of decision not to defer removal
Crimes.Court_Ruling: No live issue remains; discretion not exercised to hear moot case
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged improper timing of removal relative to H&C process
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Mootness test: existence of live controversy and discretionary exceptions
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: IRPA, particularly provisions on removal and H&C applications
Crimes.Review_Standard: Deference to administrative decisions unless procedurally unfair
Crimes.Application_Basis: Pending H&C application at time of removal
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Certification of question and stay of removal
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Courts may decline moot cases absent exceptional circumstances
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of proof of ongoing legal impact
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: No measurable effect on current or future status
Crimes.Cause_Description: Challenge to removal timing without contesting validity of removal
Crimes.Legal_Provision: IRPA s. 44 – Powers of officers regarding removal
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Issue rendered academic by removal and denial

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Mootness of judicial review following removal and H&C dismissal
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Undisputed facts based on official records
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show live controversy or collateral consequences
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Mootness doctrine limits court intervention when no effective relief possible
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness depending on context
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timeliness and justiciability of post-removal challenges
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Request for deferral of removal during H&C assessment
Crimes.Review_Standard: Mootness threshold and discretionary hearing criteria
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Administrative law principles applied to immigration decisions
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Non-deferral of removal despite pending H&C claim
Crimes.Court_Result: Refusal to exercise discretion to hear moot case
Crimes.Standard_of_Proof: Balance of probabilities for establishing mootness exceptions
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Enforcement of removal order in accordance with policy
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review and potential stay of removal
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Declaration that removal should have been deferred
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Summary dismissal based on lack of justiciable issue
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship
Crimes.Governing_Rule: A case is moot if no live controversy affects party rights
